Jacob Bautista, M.D. 989 Eldorado Circle Coeburn, WA 42646
RE: Kenneth Umstead MR #401-10-87-8
Dear Jac:
I saw your patient, Kenneth Umstead, in the Cardiology Office today and he seems like he is improved. He feels his legs are better and that he can walk greater distances. He feels very comfortable.
His current medications include Metoprolol 50 mg per day, Nifedipine XL 60 mg per day, Lasix 20 mg per day.
On exam today, he has a blood pressure of 146/76, a heart rate of 65 and regular. Weight 210 pounds. Head and neck unremarkable. Chest is clear. Cardiac exam is notable for an S4 and a I/VI systolic ejection murmur. The rest of his exam was unremarkable.
Resting 12 lead electrocardiogram is unchanged demonstrating normal sinus rhythm and a left axis deviation. There is a nonspecific intraventricular conduction delay.
I think Mr. Umstead is doing very well. He would like to have his arterial pulses rechecked noninvasively and I tried to arrange that schedule. In addition, his Metoprolol has been only once a day and if he can tolerate it twice a day he will have a better control and more prolonged risk prevention. I suggest that we increase it to 50 mg bid. I also told him how to take his pulse and he can keep an eye on it. If it drops too low we can reduce the dose. He asked that I see him again in about six months for routine re-evaluation and I will be happy to do so. If any problems develop in the interim please do not hesitate to contact me.
Thank you for allowing me to help with his care.
Kindest regards.
Kenneth Umstead MR #401-10-87-8 -2- December 19, 2073
Sincerely yours,
Marshall O. Lehman, M.D. Wilson Medical Center 23 Whipple St Tonkawa, WA 67495
